KSP: 1.0.2 Win32

Problem: Whenever I start the game, the settings will reset themselves. The game will start in fullscreen like it's supposed to, but after it finishes loading, the music will start playing (which I've turned off), it asks me if I want to send data to Squad (or whatever that thing did), everything under Graphics is what it normally defaults to (and it will change to that if I click apply/accept), controls go back to default (though one time there was a situation where it was mostly intact and only a few joystick controls were not bound). Basically I would have to do the first-run setup every time I start the game.

Initially I thought it might be caused by the settings file from 0.90.0, but after recreating those settings in 1.0.2 the problem didn't go away.

I think it started when I switched to 1.0.2 from 1.0.

This issue is often reported. It can be fixed by both deleting your settings.cfg from the KSP main directory and replacing the settings.cfg.bak in the launcher_data folder with your own.

I am sorry, it did the trick for me.

Edit: Did you do exactly the following?

1. Delete settings.cfg from KSP folder

2. Start KSP and let set all the options to your liking

3. Exit KSP

4. Copy the new settings.cfg to the Launcher_data folder

5. Backup the settings.cfg.bak from the launcher_Data folder

6. Rename the new settings.cfg in the Launcher_data folder to settings.cfg.bak

7. Start KSP

I was trying to help a user in IRC with this same issue yesterday, for him this issue was related to using an XBox controller with KSP. If the controller was off/not connected the game would not save settings, once turned on it worked fine.

Not sure if this is the cause for everyone reporting the issue, just thought I'd share it as it may help some.

It's also happening to me. Could it be related to a memory thing, though? In 0.90 one I got ATM compressing files like crazy (around 1,300-1,500 mb in Task Manager on load) as well as in a near-stock 1.0 install, it isn't an issue. In 1.0 without ATM helping me and now pegging 2700-2,900 mb RAM in Task Manager (and Sentinel going off yellow every scene change), I'm also losing my graphics and joystick axes settings after every game quit. It could also be related to plugging in the joystick (I play with the joystick on and off at times), but having the joystick config'd wasn't an issue with the near-stock 1.0, or the ATM'd 0.90 for that matter (though a few times in 0.90, I'd lose the saved settings anyway, but not after every game quit, IIRC).

Maybe they're not related (I can get that running a little heavy on the memory should have no effect on the setting configuration file at all), but I decided to share this (admittedly amateur and not well-considered) observation just in case. Indeed, it's not technically a game-breaking bug, but it is becoming worrisome--especially since I have to quit often to clear memory leaks.

No, I don't think that's related, your install is not even getting close to the x86 limit (and when it does, the whole game will just crash). I'm also still not thinking that removing the joysticks is the trigger, I never unplug mine.

I tried the work around on page 2 a couple more times and I'm still not having any luck.

Edited May 11, 2015 by Capt. Hunt

I'm having this exact same issue on 1.0.2 on OS X since I used it with my PS4 Dualshock 4 controller. The controller thing is probably the issue, it didn't exist in 0.90, I had 1.0.0 for just a day and didn't use a controller with it and never had 1.0.1 installed. 1.0.2 didn't start resetting the settings like described by OP until I noticed controller settings had disappeared since I tweaked them in 0.90 and set them again.

I hate to say it, but I tried setting only the non-controller related stuff, and it worked, which unfortunately means it is a problem with how the game sees the controllers. This also explains why the workaround worked for me once, but then broke again, the first time around I just set a couple of toggles to see if it would work at all, and then when it apparently did I tried to set the controls.

Any ideas on how to force KSP to work with Joysticks without having to go through the whole dog and pony show every time I load?

Edited May 12, 2015 by Capt. Hunt

Well, in light of that last bit of information the best we can do, probably, is to keep a backup settings file with all of your stuff the way you want it, except without the joystick binds. Then you'll have to delete the settings file and replace it with that backup each time you want to start the game and then, in-game, you just rebind all the joystick stuff. It sounds more annoying than it is (I hope) and I'm going to see if it works right now.

Edit: First of all, it works this way. Secondly I just got an idea. Those of you who have this problem, are you using PPJoy?
